actions.recommendation: Please see your Dr urgently to assess your urine, monitor your BP and insulin.
Consider seeing a dietician to help improve your diet. Include more varied fresh fruit & veggies. Limit fizzy drinks, red and organ meat.
Exercise moderately 3-5x a week. Weight loss will help lower your risk of chronic diseases and it will improve your health.
Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and to address your irregular menstrual cycle.
BP is elevated. This increases risk of cardiovascular disease. Please see your Dr to monitor this.
BMI is elevated at 46. Weight to height circumference is elevated at 71.5% This raises the risk of lifestyle diseases i.e diabetes, hypertension and their complications.
